JobFullDesc: At Freddie Mac, you will do important work to build a better housing finance system and you’ll be part of a team helping to make homeownership and rental housing more accessible and affordable across the nation. Position Overview:The Resolution Planning Senior Financial Analyst will report to the Director of Resolution Planning at Freddie Mac and will be largely responsible for supporting the Director in driving and conducting financial analysis that supports team’s efforts in meeting the FHFA’s resolution planning objectives and requirements.  The role will require a significant coordination with business and function colleagues to work on all aspects of Freddie Mac’s Resolution Plan, and the position will be primarily responsible for supporting the plan’s financial analysis and the development of new forecasting capabilities.  This is an exciting opportunity as resolution planning is new to the GSEs.  In addition, this role will liaise with other areas within the Capital and Resolution Planning division in order to gauge capital management from both a going and gone perspective. **This position can be performed from the McLean, VA or New York office location. **Our Impact:The Capital and Resolution Planning division is responsible for the planning, forecasting, and optimization of capital.  The team focuses on the oversight of all capital management, capital planning and elements related to risk appetite and capital contingency, as well as strategic and policy initiatives.  Resolution Planning is a new addition within the capital team and will offer new opportunities across all areas.  In addition to driving something new, the position will also help and design the designation of Freddie Mac’s Core Business Lines, develop the Enterprises’ resolution strategic analysis, financial analysis, and capabilities.  In this regard, the role will support a wide range of analytical work that will help decide and support Freddie’s strategies – including capital planning, resolution planning and capabilities within the stress testing framework. Your Impact:As a member of the Capital and Resolution Planning Team you will:Partner with the Resolution Planning Director and Team, as well as colleagues across Freddie Mac’s businesses and divisions, including Legal, Operations, Investments and Capital Markets, Regulatory Affairs, Finance, Enterprise Risk, as well as other departments to support the design and development of the Resolution Plan.Support the design and implementation of a resolution planning process that aligns with enterprise, regulatory and stakeholder expectations.Focus on the development and implementation of financial capabilities for the resolution program, including financial forecasting, capital and liquidity analyses and metrics.Utilize these financial capabilities to conduct detailed analyses and develop conclusions regarding the enterprise’s resolvability.Support the initial development of regulatory materials support Freddie Mac’s resolution plan, including analyses used to support management and regulators make key decisions regarding its strategy and approach. Support other areas within capital to help garner a more comprehensive view of capital across a stress continuum (from a BAU, stress and resolution perspective)Qualifications:5-7 years of related professional / industry experience –
